metadata.title: CVE-2017-5126 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free in PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.62 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted PDFfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5126` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.62-0ubuntu0.17.10.1380').
